subject: Re: [junit] Pondering adding a new test result state....
msgSnippet: We _almost_ had a very similar state in 4.5, and pulled it out at the last minute, because we couldn t convince ourselves that the benefit outweighed the cost
messageBody:
We _almost_ had a very similar state in 4.5, and pulled it out at the
last minute, because we couldn't convince ourselves that the benefit
outweighed the cost in UI complexity and modification.

I think that adding a "reason" to testIgnored would probably be the
best way to go: your Skipped tests could be ignored tests with a
reason attached. UIs generally have caught up to ignored tests, but
also have a way to display failure messages on failed tests, so the UI
for an ignored test with a reason seems pretty straightforward. What
do you think?

David

On Tue, Apr 28, 2009 at 1:26 PM, Forsberg, Mike
<mike.forsberg@...> wrote:
> I have a feeling that somebody out there has some good information on
> this... So before I go and start modifying code...
>
>
>
> Is the result state of "Skipped" a good idea?
>
>
>
> The reason I'm asking... I think I've improved upon JUnitExt's
> Prerequisite annotation.  However, I've run into the case where all
> tests are filtered out.  Thus, I'd like to add a "Skipped" state.
>
>
>
> Anyone have any feelings about this?
>
>
>
> Big Mike
>
>
>
